content: times ending after round 14 to get the same result as shown in the pictures you can shorten or lengthen the leg by leaving out or adding rounds heel increases this section is still worked in rounds rounds 1-35 work chart 2 then work chart 1 from stitch 4 to the end of the round chart 2 will replace the first stitches of chart 1 and incorporate all the increases that you will need for the heel work chart 2 row 36 to stitch 24 for chart 2 lb or stitch 20 chart 2 plain you are now in the middle of the heel section heel turn this section is worked in row please make sure to keep the floats to the inner side of the sole when working wrong-side row we will now get rid of all lb stitches on the back side of the sock  whenever the symbol indicates to knit a stitch and there s an lb stitch behind this stitch work an ssk with the knit stitch and the lb stitch  whenever the symbol indicates to purl a stitch and there s an lb stitch behind your stitch purl those two stitches together  when the symbol indicates to ssk and there s an lb stitch behind the first or second stitch that you would need to ssk slip all three stitches individually as if to knit return them to the left needle and knit them together through the back loop remember to treat lb stitches as one stitch only even if they con- sist of two loops  when the symbol indicates to p2tog and there s an lb stitch behind the first or second stitch that you would need to p2tog purl all three stitches together remember to treat lb stitches as one stitch only even if they consist of two loops at the beginning of each row the yarns need to be twisted turn the work clockwise at the end of rs and counter clockwise at the end of ws and hold the yarns in the same order when turning all row should be worked like this slip 1 work rest of row as shown in chart 3 row 1-35 work chart 3 - up to the green line start working in rounds again work the next row of chart 1 stitch 24 to 67 for chart 1 lb / stitch 21 to 57 chart 1 plain then work row 36 of chart 3 5 the foot continue to work in the round knitting the next round of chart 1 stitches 24 to 67 for chart 1 lb / 21 to 57 for chart 1 plain on the instep and chart 4 on the sole measure your gauge at the sole as the sole stitches tend to have a different gauge than the lb stitch section the toe section will have 22 row determine how long your toe section will be with my sole gauge that s 6 1 cm /
